question: You’re really busy at work and a colleague is telling you their life story and personal woes. You:

options.B: Think it’s more important to give them some of your time; work can wait
options.C: Listen, but with only with half an ear
options.D: Interrupt and explain that you are really busy at the moment

question: You've been sitting in the doctor's waiting room for more than 25 minutes. You:

options.A: Look at your watch every two minutes
options.B: Bubble with inner anger, but keep quiet
options.C: Explain to other equally impatient people in the room that the doctor is always running late
options.D: Complain in a loud voice, while tapping your foot impatiently

question: You're having an animated discussion with a colleague regarding a project that you're in charge of. You:

options.B: Think that they are obviously right
options.C: Defend your own point of view, tooth and nail

question: You are taking part in a guided tour of a museum. You:

options.A: Are a bit too far towards the back so don’t really hear what the guide is saying
options.C: Make sure that everyone is able to hear properly
options.D: Are right up the front, adding your own comments in a loud voice

question: During dinner parties at your home, you have a hard time with people who:

options.A: Ask you to tell a story in front of everyone else
options.D: Always drag the conversation back to themselves

question: You crack a joke at work, but nobody seems to have noticed. You:

options.A: Think it’s for the best — it was a lame joke anyway
options.B: Wait to share it with your friends after work
options.C: Try again a bit later with one of your colleagues
options.D: Keep telling it until they pay attention

question: This morning, your agenda seems to be free. You:

options.A: Know that somebody will find a reason to come and bother you
options.B: Heave a sigh of relief and look forward to a day without stress
options.C: Tell your colleagues about a project that’s been worrying you
options.D: Pick up the phone and start filling up your agenda with meetings

question: During dinner, the discussion moves to a subject about which you know nothing at all. You:

options.A: Don’t dare show that you don’t know anything about the subject
options.C: Ask lots of questions to learn more about it

question: You're out with a group of friends and there's a person who's quite shy and doesn't talk much. You:

options.A: Notice that they’re alone, but don’t go over to talk with them
options.B: Go and have a chat with them
options.C: Shoot some friendly smiles in their direction

question: At work, somebody asks for your help for the hundredth time. You:

options.A: Give them a hand, as usual
options.B: Accept — you’re known for being helpful
options.C: Ask them, please, to find somebody else for a change
options.D: Loudly make it known that you’re annoyed

question: You've been see a movie with your family and the reviews are mixed. You:

options.A: Don’t share your point of view with anyone
options.B: Didn’t like the film, but keep your views to yourself when asked
options.C: State your point of view with enthusiasm
options.D: Try to bring the others round to your point of view

question: A friend arrives late for your meeting. You:

options.A: Say, ‘It’s not a problem,’ even if that’s not what you really think
options.B: Give them a filthy look and sulk for the rest of the evening
options.C: Tell them, ‘You’re too much! Have you seen the time?’
options.D: Make a scene in front of everyone

question: You can't find your car keys. You:

options.A: Don’t want anyone to find out, so you take the bus instead
options.B: Panic and search madly without asking anyone for help
options.C: Grumble without telling your family why you’re in a bad mood
options.D: Accuse those around you for misplacing them

question: It's time for your annual appraisal with your boss. You:

options.A: Go with great hesitation as these sessions are torture for you
options.B: Look forward to hearing what your boss thinks about you and expects from you
options.C: Rehearse ad nauseam the arguments and ideas that you’ve prepared for the meeting
options.D: Go along unprepared as you are confident and like improvising
